text: My favorite navy curry is definitely the one at Kurihama Ferry Port.
Kurihama Flower park is really funtastic. You will be atracted to Sunflowers planted through the valley vin summer.
Kannonzaki Lighthouse is amazing, it's a little scary but once you climb up you get amazing views of Tokyo Bay and the coastline.
Prefectural Route 212 is the perfect road with the great coastal view of the Tokyo Bay. You can enjoy driving with a car, motarcycle and bike. Of course walking is also asesome.
It's amazing that you can get from Kurihama to Chiba by Tokyo Bay Ferry in just 40 minutes. You'll lose track of time as you enjoy the spectacular views of Tokyo Bay on board.
Food is delicious and reasonable in Kurihama. My favorite is a famous ramen restaurant "Ohako".
I like to eat mochi and cheese sandwiched between nori seaweed and dipped in soy sauce in winter.
Aside from Kaigun Curry, the curry at "Bengal" in front of Yokosuka Chuo Station was delicious.
The sweets at Sakamotoya in front of Yokosuka Chuo Station were delicious.
